document.masterDocTitle: Studies in Liocranidae (Araneae): redescriptions and transfers in Apostenus Westring and Brachyanillus Simon, as well as description of a new genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Studies in Liocranidae (Araneae): redescriptions and transfers in Apostenus Westring and Brachyanillus Simon, as well as description of a new genus

bibRefCitation.author: Simon
bibRefCitation.refString: Simon, E. (1932) Les arachnides de France. Tome VI. Synopsis generale et catalogue des especes francaises de l'ordre des Araneae; 4 e partie, 773 - 978. Roret, Paris.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype male, no further data [ MNHN 25305 ]
.

Additional material examined. 13 ♀, "
Ap. humilis E.S. Pyr.
or." [ MNHN 1758 ]
;
11 ♀, "Banyuls
Apostenus humilis
E.S. in litt ." [ MNHN - Coll. Berland 4.25.9.62]
;
21 ♀, "
Apostenus humilis
E.S. in litteris et det. Banyuls 09" [ MNHN 25 ]
;
18 ♀, "
Apostenus humilis E.S. Pyr. Or. Amélie
" [ MNHN ]
.

Diagnosis.
A. humilis
is close to
A. maroccanus
but differs from it by the more slender embolus and the longer MA, as well as by the median epigynal septum which is subtriangular and not lozenge-shaped.

Arabelia pheidoleicomes
, female holotype.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Male ( holotype ). Total length 2.03 . Carapace length 0.97 ,
w 0.79
, unicolorous pale yellow, fovea brown, pronounced, length 0.16 , anterior end 0.66 from front end of carapace. MOQ depth 0.13 , anterior
w 0.08
, posterior
w 0.14
. AER
w 0.21
, PER
w 0.27
. AME small, with dark retina restricted to median 2 / 3 of eye. Clypeus slightly narrower than diameter of AME. Chelicerae pale yellow, three very small teeth along promarginal cheliceral rim, two small teeth on retromarginal rim, close to position of fang tip. Sternum pale yellow, length 0.58 ,
w 0.50
. Abdomen pale yellowish brown. No rh present. Leg length I 2.95 II 2.71 III 2.66 IV 3.50 . Leg spination (
Fig. 2 B
) fe: I do 1 - 1 -0 plv 0- 0-1 ; II do 1 - 1 -0; III do 1 - 1 -0; IV do 1 - 1-2 ; ti: I plv 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 rlv 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 ; II plv 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 rlv 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 ; III pl 0- 0-1 plv 0-1 - 1 rlv 0- 0-1 ; IV pl 0- 0-1 do 1 - 0-1 rl 0- 1 - 1 plv 1 - 1 - 1 rlv 0- 0-1 ; mt: I plv 1 - 1 - 1 rlv 1 - 1 - 1 ; II plv 1 - 1 - 1 rlv 1 - 1 - 1 ; III pl 0-1 - 1 rl 0-1 - 1 plv 1 - 0-1 rlv 1 -0- 0; IV pl 1 -0-0 rl 1 - 1 -0 plv 1 - 0-1 rlv 1 - 0-1 vts 1 .

Female ( MNHN 25 ). Total length 3.42 . Carapace length 1.18 ,
w 0.97
, unicolorous pale yellow, fovea brown, pronounced, length 0.21 , anterior end 0.79 from front end of carapace. MOQ depth 0.14 , anterior
w 0.11
, posterior
w 0.18
. AER
w 0.26
, PER
w 0.32
. AME as in male. Clypeus equal to diameter of AME. Chelicerae as in male. Sternum pale yellow, length 0.74 ,
w 0.66
. Abdomen pale yellowish brown. No rh. Leg length I 3.37 II 3.16 III 3.13 IV 4.29 . Leg spination (
Fig. 2 C
) fe: I pl 0- 0-1 do 1 - 1 -0 plv 0-1 - 1 ; II do 1 - 1 -0; III do 1 - 1 - 1 ; IV do 1 - 1-2 ; ti: I plv 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 rlv 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 ; II plv 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 rlv 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 ; III pl 0-1 - 1 do 0- 0-1 rl 1 - 0-1 plv 0-1 - 1 rlv 0- 0-1 ; IV pl 0-1 - 1 do 1 - 0-1 rl 0-1 - 1 plv 1 - 1 - 1 rlv 0- 0-1 ; mt: I plv 1 - 1 - 1 rlv 1 - 1 - 1 ; II plv 1 - 1 - 1 rlv 1 - 1 - 1 ; III pl 0-1 - 1 rl 0-1 - 1 plv 1 - 0-1 rlv 1 -0-0; IV pl 1 - 0-1 rl 1 - 1 - 1 plv 1 -0-0 rlv 1 -0-0 vts 1 . Paired ve spines on ti and mt I and II strong in both sexes, as typical for the genus.

Distribution.
Platnick ( 2009 )
mentions only France , but the species has been reported from the Iberian Peninsula as well (
Cardoso 2000
;
Morano 2004
).
